benchmark_details.name: ManiPose
benchmark_details.overview: ManiPose is a pioneering benchmark designed to advance the study of pose-varying manipulation tasks, encompassing simulation environments for POM, a comprehensive dataset with geometrically consistent 6D pose labels, and a baseline method leveraging LLM capabilities for enhanced manipulation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To catalyze the development of learning algorithms for pose-aware object manipulation (POM).

data.source: Real-world scanned rigid objects from YCB, OmniObject3D, PACE, and articulated objects from PartNet Mobility.
data.annotation: Geometrically consistent and manipulation-oriented 6D pose labels.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy measured through origin error and orientation error comparisons against ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Lower origin and orientation errors indicate better pose estimation and manipulation effectiveness.
methodology.baseline_results: Results demonstrate notable improvements in pose estimation and manipulation success rates.
methodology.validation: Validation occurs through experiments in simulated environments and real-robot implementations.
